thread.title: Highest paid college football coaches in Texas
thread.title_full: Highest paid college football coaches in Texas - San Antonio Express-News

author: Nick Moyle, San Antonio Express-News
title: Highest paid college football coaches in Texas
text:

Image 1 of 13 School : Texas Coach : Charlie Strong Record at Texas : 7-11 2015 Salary (Rank out of 121) : $5,100,270 (6)
Bonus Money Non-CFP bowl appearance: $25,000

Bonus Money Appearance in non-CFP bowl game other than Capital One or Outback: $50,000
Photo: Brett Coomer /Houston Chronicle School : Texas A&M Coach : Kevin Sumlin Record at Texas A&M : 33-11 2015... Image 3 of 13 School : Baylor Coach : Art Briles Record at Baylor : 59-34 2015 Salary : $4,238,573 (11)

School : Baylor Coach : Art Briles Record at Baylor : 59-34 2015... Image 4 of 13 School : TCU Coach : Gary Patterson Record at TCU : 137-45 2015 Salary : $3,940,026 (19)
Bonus Money N/A
Photo: Tom Pennington, Staff / Getty Images School : TCU Coach : Gary Patterson Record at TCU : 137-45 2015... Image 5 of 13 School : Texas Tech Coach : Kliff Kingsbury Record at Texas Tech : 15-15 2015 Salary : $3,147,500 (31)
Bonus Money Average paid home attendance at least 95% of paid seating capacity: $50,000 Single-year Academic Progress Rate (APR) at least 950: $20,000 Total: $70,000
Note on APR : Academic Progress Rate (APR) holds institutions accountable for the academic progress of their student-athletes through a team-based metric that accounts for the eligibility and retention of each student-athlete for each academic term
Photo: Tori Eichberger, MBI / Associated Press School : Texas Tech Coach : Kliff Kingsbury Record at Texas Tech :... Image 6 of 13 School : Houston Coach : Tom Herman Record at Houston : 4-0 2015 Salary : $1,450,000 (61)
Bonus Money N/A - First year as head coach at Houston.
Income Notes School pay includes $100,000 that annually accrues to Herman if he remains head coach on Dec. 31. Three years' worth of these amounts will vest to Herman if he remains head coach on Feb. 28, 2018. That money, plus any additional annual amounts, will become payable if he is fired without cause after that date, or he will receive $500,000 if he completes his contract Feb. 29, 2020
Photo: Thomas B. Shea /For The Houston Chronicle School : Houston Coach : Tom Herman Record at Houston : 4-0 2015 Salary :... Image 7 of 13 School : Rice Coach : David Bailiff Record at Rice : 50-56 2015 Salary : $805,088 (79)
Bonus Money N/A
Photo: Smiley N. Pool / Houston Chronicle School : Rice Coach : David Bailiff Record at Rice : 50-56 2015 Salary :... Image 8 of 13 School : North Texas Coach : Dan McCarney Record at North Texas : 22-33 2015 Salary : $721,600 (85)
Bonus Money $0
Income Notes School pay includes a $70,000 payment McCarney will receive only if he remains head coach through the team’s final game of the season, including any bowl game.
Photo: Butch Dill, Getty Images School : North Texas Coach : Dan McCarney Record at North Texas :... Image 9 of 13 School: UTEP Coach: Sean Kugler Record at UTEP: 11-19 2015 Salary: $509,541 (105)
Bonus money Multi-year Academic Progress Rate (APR) of 930-or-better: $23,655 After 6 wins, gets 1 month's base pay for each additional win (1 such win): $23,655 Non-"BCS" bowl game: $23,655 Nike bonus for participation in Gildan New Mexico Bowl: $4,079 Total: $75,044
Photo: Smiley N. Pool, Houston Chronicle School: UTEP Coach: Sean Kugler Record at UTEP: 11-19 2015... Image 10 of 13 School : UTSA Coach : Larry Coker Record at UTEP : 20-21 2015 Salary : 427,150 (110)
Bonus Money $0
Photo: Eric Gay /Associated Press School : UTSA Coach : Larry Coker Record at UTEP : 20-21 2015 Salary :... Image 11 of 13 School : Texas State Coach : Dennis Franchione Record at Texas State : 18-22 2015 Salary : $425,000 (111)
Bonus Money APR greater than 960 but not greater than 970: $7,500
Photo: Eric Gay, AP School : Texas State Coach : Dennis Franchione Record at Texas State :... Image 12 of 13 School : SMU Coach : Chad Morris Record at SMU : 1-4 2015 Salary : N/A

Income Notes Information not provided to USA Today .
Photo: LM Otero /Associated Press School : SMU Coach : Chad Morris Record at SMU : 1-4 2015 Salary :... Image 13 of 13 Highest paid college football coaches in Texas 1 / 13 Back to Gallery If you needed a reminder that college football — college athletics, in general — has become an arms race, look no further than USA Today's recently released list of FBS college football coaching salaries .
The amount of money on display, from No. 1 (Nick Saban, Alabama) to No. 121 (Todd Berry, Lousiana-Monroe), is staggering.
Four coaches hailing from Texas schools rank among the top 20: Charlie Strong, Kevin Sumlin, Art Briles and Gary Patterson.
RELATED: Highest paid high school football coaches in San Antonio
According to USA Today sports projects reporter and editor Steve Berkowitz, the number of FBS football head coaches making at least $3 million has near quintupled in the past half-decade, from 7 in 2010 to 34 this season.
Some of these amounts exceed even what NFL head coaches make. San Francisco 49ers coach Jim Tomsula makes $3.5 million a year; that would place him just 25th among all FBS coaches.
The tactical proliferation of FBS programs extends far beyond inflated coaching salaries though, especially among the Power Five conferences.
Texas A&M just spent over $450 million on renovations to Kyle Field.
Texas signed a 20-year agreemen t with ESPN for the Longhorn Network in 2011, which nets the university $10,980,000 per year, with an annual increase of three percent.
Oregon's athletic revenue nearly touched $200 million in 2014.
Auburn spent $126 million last year, despite bringing in just over $113 million.
All this in the pursuit of teenagers and, with the unpalatable way recruiting has evolved, preteens.
It's a troubling contest which has left the National Collegiate Athletic Association and many of its 128 FBS schools looking less like "amateur" organizations and more like professional football teams.
Click through the slideshow above to see where each coach of a Texas university ranks.
